title: Gangland widow Roberta Williams sends a message to her slain drug boss husband Carl Williams
text:
Gangland widow Roberta Williams has paid tribute to her slain drug boss husband on what would have been his 49th birthday.

The wife of murdered underworld figure Carl Williams took to Instagram on Sunday with a gushing post about his legacy and her memories of their time together.

'Today we will have a shot of ouzo for you, your favourite drink,' she wrote.

'I smile when I think of the happy memories you left us with 'cos you lived life to the fullest and my god did you make us laugh. You are our Forever Angel.'

Roberta, 50, who is facing criminal charges including making threats to kill, wrote: 'There is nothing I wouldn't do to have you here'.

Roberta Williams posted this montage to Instagram in memory of her later husband Carl who was killed in prison

Gangland widow Roberta Williams paid tribute to her slain drug boss husband on what would have been his 49th birthday

The wife of murdered underworld figure Carl Williams (with daughter Dhakota) took to Instagram on Sunday, where she remembered their life together

Williams faces allegations she threatened to kill a producer, who had been working on a reality show about her life

Carl's daughter Dhakota, who turned 18 earlier this year, also posted a birthday message on Instagram to her 34,600 followers.

The message was a picture of her as a toddler in her father's arms captioned 'happy birthday angel'.

She was just nine years old when her father Carl was bludgeoned to death inside Barwon Prison by fellow inmate Matthew Charles Johnson in 2010.

Her gangster dad was serving a 35-year jail sentence for ordering the murders of three players in the Melbourne gangland wars which claimed more than 30 victims in the late 1990s and early 2000s.

He had already been sentenced for conspiring to murder a fourth.

Roberta Williams is currently on bail amid allegations she threatened to kill a reality TV producer in July who was helping her create a show based on her life.

Three charges against her - including kidnapping and causing serious injury - were dropped.

She will remain on bail until her next scheduled court appearance in 2020.
